intro: Laxoplumeria verticillata, commonly known as the spiral-leaved shrub, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite or whorled, depending on the growth stage. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
